Subject: Re: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=12653864; y=lpD6pJhbmLekgt52WLYetzcM6Iyf8Ozo5o4Y0o1pSjrEqavg

Jeff Nielsen wrote:

> 2) Many tests are tightly coupled and are exercising the same lines of code 
> (bad)

This is unavoidable and not necessarily bad. Some lines of code in a 
system are simply likely to be more fundamental than others and a 
breakage there will cascade. For example, suppose you're writing unit 
tests for the AWT or an AWT-like system. Now suppose you break the 
function that draw rectangles. This would break every method that needs 
to draw rectangles, including functions for drawing dialog boxes, menus, 
windows, and a lot more. Most functions won't be so critical to so much 
of the system, but a few are likely to be.

--
